H0.text: Metabolic rate and body temperature both increase during dormancy and hibernation in animals.

H1.text: Metabolic rate and body temperature both decrease during dormancy and hibernation in animals.

H2.text: Metabolic rate increases and body temperature decreases are how dormancy and hibernation are similar in animals.

H3.text: Metabolic rate decreases and body temperature increases are the similarities between dormancy and hibernation in animals.

A4.text: To achieve this energy saving, an endothermic animal decreases its metabolic rate and thereby its body temperature.

A5.text: Hibernation is a state of minimal activity and metabolic reduction entered by some animal species.
